required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Early Detection of COVID-19 Using Breath Analysis
clinical_study.official_title: Early Detection of the 2019 Novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) Using Breath Analysis: First Cross-Sectional Study

brief_summary.textblock: EARLY DETECTION OF COVID-19 USING BREATH ANALYSIS- FIRST CROSS-SECTIONAL STUDY

detailed_description.textblock: Primary objective- to identify and evaluate a set of biomarkers that represent both the genetic expression of the virus itself (SARS-CoV-2) and the metabolic activity of the immune system's response to the virus.

clinical_study.why_stopped: no additional parcipitants could be recruited at site.

primary_outcome.measure: Correlation between Volatile Organic Compounds pattern and COVID-19 detection status.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through the study completion, up to 3 months.
primary_outcome.description: Correlation between the set of Volatile Organic Compounds found in breath biopsy and COVID-19 detection presence in a swab test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between Volatile Organic Compounds pattern and time from COVID-19 detection.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through the study completion, up to 3 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between the set of Volatile Organic Compounds found in breath biopsy and time since COVID-19 detected in a swab test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between the set of Volatile Organic Compounds found in breath biopsy and disease intensity.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through the study completion, up to 3 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between the set of Volatile Organic Compounds found in breath biopsy and intensity of COVID-19 detected in a swab test.

arm_group.description: subjects who were found COVID-19 Positive according to swab test.
subjects who were found COVID-19 Negative according to swab test.

intervention.intervention_name: Breath biopsy sampling using the ReCIVA Breath Sampler
intervention.description: Breath biopsy sampling using the ReCIVA Breath Sampler

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18 to 55 years at the time of consent
- Positive results for SARS-CoV-2
- Capable of understanding written and/or spoken language
- Able to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age under 18 years old
- (Anticipated) inability to complete breath sampling procedure due to e.g. hyper- or hypoventilation, respiratory failure, or claustrophobia when wearing the sampling mask
- Persons under guardianship or deprived of liberty
- Patients with the following diseases: Cancer, Asthma, Chronic Respiratory Disease
- Pregnant women
- Treated with antiviral drugs upon admission or during hospitalization
- Novices and soldiers in initial training

patient_data.ipd_description: No IPD is to be shared with other researchers.
